keyMoments.title: Oars Awakens After 500 Years
keyMoments.description: The corpse of Oars the Continent-Puller opens his eyes for the first time since his death over 500 years ago, brought back to life as a zombie with Luffy's shadow implanted by Gecko Moria.
keyMoments.significance: This marks the debut of the most powerful zombie in Moria's army and one of the main antagonists of the Thriller Bark arc.

keyMoments.title: Oars' First Words
keyMoments.description: Immediately upon awakening, Oars bellows for meat and calls for Sanji, demonstrating that he has inherited Luffy's personality, appetite, and memories through the shadow transfer.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Oars as having Luffy's personality while also showing that shadow memories fade over time.
keyMoments.quote: Sanji! Make me some food! ...Wait, who's Sanji?

keyMoments.title: Oars Refuses to Obey Moria
keyMoments.description: When commanded to become Moria's underling, Oars refuses and declares he won't follow anyone's orders, mirroring Luffy's independent spirit.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Luffy's strong will has transferred to Oars, creating problems for Moria's plans.
keyMoments.quote: I'm not going to be anyone's underling!

keyMoments.title: Oars Declares He Will Become Pirate King
keyMoments.description: After breaking free and leaping outside the freezer, Oars proclaims that he will become the Pirate King, inheriting Luffy's core dream.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that even the most fundamental aspects of Luffy's identity have been transferred through the shadow.
keyMoments.quote: I'm going to become the Pirate King!

statusHistory.description: Died 500 years ago in the Land of Ice from exposure and frostbite
Resurrected as a zombie by Gecko Moria with Luffy's shadow

abilities.description: As an ancient giant, Oars possesses tremendous physical strength capable of breaking chains and punching through massive structures.
As a zombie, Oars feels no pain and has enhanced durability, though he is weak to salt and sunlight.

relationships.description: Oars was resurrected by Gecko Moria to serve as his ultimate zombie warrior, though Oars resists following orders due to Luffy's shadow.

evolutionMoments.description: Moria implants Luffy's shadow into Oars and attempts to command him, but Oars refuses to obey.

relationships.description: Oars has Luffy's shadow implanted in his corpse, giving him Luffy's personality, memories, and dreams.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy's shadow is forcibly implanted into Oars' corpse by Gecko Moria, creating a connection between the two.

reveals.information: Oars was an infamous ancient giant who died 500 years ago in the Land of Ice
Oars has been resurrected as a zombie with Luffy's shadow, giving him Luffy's personality and dreams
Wants to become King of the Pirates (inherited from Luffy's shadow)

keyMoments.title: Moria Implants Luffy's Shadow into Oars
keyMoments.description: Gecko Moria uses his Kage Kage no Mi powers to forcibly implant Luffy's shadow into Oars' corpse, creating his ultimate zombie warrior.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the full extent of Moria's shadow manipulation abilities and completes his master plan.
keyMoments.quote: No matter how much the shadow struggles, it will obey me!

keyMoments.title: Nami Abducted by Absalom
keyMoments.description: Absalom uses his Suke Suke no Mi powers to turn invisible and kidnap Nami with the intention of making her his bride.
keyMoments.significance: Puts Nami in immediate danger and motivates the Straw Hats to rescue her.

keyMoments.title: Usopp Uses Rokuren Mamushi Boshi
keyMoments.description: Usopp fires his Rokuren Mamushi Boshi technique, shooting six explosive projectiles in a snake-like pattern to try to stop Absalom from kidnapping Nami.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the anime debut of this Kabuto technique, showcasing Usopp's improved arsenal.

abilities.description: Six Chamber Pit-Viper Star - Six explosive projectiles are shot simultaneously in a snake-like pattern from the Kabuto slingshot.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Chopper Explains Shadow Personality Transfer
keyMoments.description: Chopper deduces and explains to the crew that Dr. Hogback creates zombies by implanting shadows that carry the personalities and memories of their original owners, though these fade over time.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial information about how Moria's zombie creation process works and the mechanics of the Kage Kage no Mi.
keyMoments.quote: Dr. Hogback is the one making the zombies! They steal personalities with the shadows inside them. Hogback is using people like pawns!

keyMoments.title: Franky Rescues with Salt
keyMoments.description: Franky arrives with Robin to rescue Usopp and Chopper, using salt to purify the zombie soldiers attacking them.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' knowledge of the zombies' weakness and reunites four crew members.

keyMoments.title: Robin Rescues with Salt
keyMoments.description: Robin works with Franky to rescue Usopp and Chopper from zombie soldiers by using salt to purify them.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the Straw Hats working together with knowledge of zombie weaknesses.

keyMoments.title: Absalom Abducts Nami
keyMoments.description: Using his Suke Suke no Mi invisibility powers, Absalom kidnaps Nami with the intention of making her his bride.
keyMoments.significance: Initiates a major subplot and sets up Absalom's confrontation with Sanji.
keyMoments.quote: You'll make a perfect bride, Nami!
